meanings.definition: (of a voice) Hoarse or rough in sound.
meanings.sent1: After cheering loudly at the game, his voice became croaky.
meanings.sent2: Her croaky voice made it difficult to understand her over the phone.
meanings.sent3: The croaky voice of the old man singing karaoke was surprisingly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The croaky voice of the rusty old gate echoed through the empty field.
meanings.sent5: The croaky voice of the frog in the pond was a familiar sound of summer.
